image.altText: A blonde woman stands in front of a cityscape.

props.synopsis: Hannah Jayne graduated without an ATAR, then spent five years working at her local mine before she found her calling as a paramedic.

title.children: Young woman swaps high-vis for higher education to become paramedic

image.altText: GettyImages-2088589379

props.synopsis: The AFL says the umpires in Saturday's Crows and Suns clash made two errors that may have cost Adelaide the game. Follow live.

title.children: AFL admits double error in Rankine call, as the Giants host the Eagles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AFL says Izak Rankine decision was wrong
Today's AFL games and what time they start

image.altText: A worker welding some steel with sparks flying.

props.synopsis: Some Australian steel businesses have seen the price of steel drop sharply in the wake of Donald Trump's steel tariffs, but there are fears the glut of imported steel is threatening the viability of Australian manufacturers.

title.children: 'Deals to be had' as US tariffs send steel prices plummeting

image.altText: A mosaic pattern on a sculpture of an Indigenous woman wearing a cloak with a baby and waves

props.synopsis: The dream of an Italian fisherman to pay tribute to the women of the South Australian town of Southend has come true with a mosaic monument recognising their role in the town's history.

title.children: Mosaic monument to women pioneers who helped create fishing industry

image.altText: Riley Bice hugs Luke Parker after Swans-Kangaroos AFL match.

props.synopsis: In just his third senior match, Riley Bice repays the faith shown by the Swans in the 65-point mauling of the Kangaroos.

title.children: Swans coach Cox glowing in praise of mature age recruit

image.altText: A player holding a ball preparing to throw. Two players go head to head on the side

props.synopsis: Adelaide Thunderbirds coach Tania Obst says two key players will be fit to play as the side begins its quest for a record three consecutive national netball league titles.

title.children: Thunderbirds to chase history as Super Netball launches season

image.altText: Two women smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Labor has selected candidates to "fly the flag" in safe federal Liberal seats Grey and Barker a month before Australians go to the polls.

title.children: Labor names late-starter candidates in 'unwinnable' SA seats

image.altText: Nicolle flint in a grey blazer against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Ahead of the federal election, the Liberal candidate for Boothby, Nicolle Flint, reflects on the factors behind her decision to leave — and now return to — politics.

title.children: Can a former incumbent unseat a sitting MP in this marginal SA seat?

image.altText: Four astronauts in spacesuits link arms and smile for the camera

props.synopsis: After orbiting the north and south poles in a privately funded flight, four space tourists have safely splashed down in the Pacific Ocean.

title.children: SpaceX crew with Australian polar explorer returns to Earth

image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: The lawyer for an Adelaide councillor elected in a result found to have been affected by "illegal practices" is seeking to have the case reopened — but an opposing lawyer has likened that move to a "Hail Mary pass" in gridiron.

title.children: Councillor's lawyer trying to perform 'Hail Mary pass', court told

image.altText: Erin Phillips holds the ball in two hands as she prepares to kick the ball in a 2020 AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Dual sport star Erin Phillips won three AFLW Premierships and was a two-time WNBA champion. But her new biography describes the 'terrible' damage inflicted by skinfold tests and the Opals bodysuit uniform.

title.children: 'I hated my body': Erin Phillips opens up on body image issues

image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: The head of South Australia's Women's and Children's Hospital has ordered a review of the state's gender diversity service, after the clinic did not refer almost two dozen children to a psychiatrist in line with government guidelines.

title.children: Review ordered into SA gender diversity service's compliance with state guidelines

image.altText: An AdelaideMetro bus front is damaged from smashing head first into tree next to a carpark. Firefighters stand next to bus

props.synopsis: A driver has been freed from the wreckage of a bus that hit a tree at the O-Bahn interchange in Adelaide's north-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Driver sustains 'significant injuries' after Adelaide Metro bus crashes into tree

image.altText: Adelaide businessman Solomon Farah wears sunglasses and a suit as he is questioned by journalists on a city street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide businessman accused of sexually assaulting nine women over two decades has been ordered to stand trial, and lost a request to have his home detention bail conditions relaxed.

title.children: Businessman accused of sexual assault loses 'unacceptable' bail relaxation bid

image.altText: Matthew Clarke, Chelsea Randall and Erin Phillips hold premiership cup

props.synopsis: Matthew Clarke makes the decision to step down as Adelaide's coach ahead of this year's AFLW season after leading the Crows to two premierships.

title.children: Dual AFLW premiership-winning coach Clarke to step away from Crows

image.altText: cracked dry soil surrounded by dry shrub

props.synopsis: The imposition of US import tariffs is the latest in a long series of challenges for SA farmers, who have battled frost and flooding in recent years, and are currently contending with drought.

title.children: Farmers have battled floods, frost and drought — and now US tariffs

image.altText: Two man sitting next to each other in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Residents and businesses in a Victorian town hit by a major hailstorm six months ago say insurance companies are moving too slow and offering paltry payouts.

title.children: Restaurant owners with $90k hail bill offered $28k by insurer

image.altText: A man opens his mouth wide as he hands out bags to two kids, surrounded by media

props.synopsis: It's not unusual for a federal election campaign to overlap with Eid al-Fitr, one of the most important days in the Muslim calendar. It is the absence of many senior politicians at traditional community events that raises eyebrows.

title.children: 'The message is being received': Anger over politicians at prayers boils over

image.altText: An illustration treatment of Donald Trump, from behind, walking between two curtains

props.synopsis: Some of America’s strongest allies are rethinking their relationship as Donald Trump’s isolationism threats to entirely remake the West.

title.children: We may be seeing the start of the 'anti-America century'

image.altText: Hundreds of people stand outside looking toward three bodies which have been wrapped in a white and red cloth

props.synopsis: Australia has joined international demands for an independent investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers in southern Gaza after Israeli forces opened fire on their convoy.

title.children: Australia joins demands for investigation into killing of Palestinian medics

image.altText: Elon musk stands behind donald trump in the oval office with his arms folded

props.synopsis: With US President Donald Trump's tariffs risking a global trade war and a US recession, the Australian share market is set to dive when it opens on Monday morning.

title.children: Australian dollar plunges as Elon Musk hopes for 'zero-tariff situation'

image.altText: A middle aged woman with long brown hair and pink rimmed glasses smiling

props.synopsis: A project led by autistic people has been holding events and training staff at some of Australia’s biggest arts institutions to help them become more inclusive.

title.children: One of the biggest myths about autistic people — and why it isn't true

image.altText: Group of sheep surrounded by floodwaters

props.synopsis: As communities in Queensland reel from yet another round of devastating rain and floods, which caught people by surprise, it prompts the question: Is forecasting extreme rainfall getting harder?

title.children: Rainfall not matching the forecast have angered communities

image.altText: Mokbel - family

props.synopsis: After 18 years behind bars, the underworld drug trafficker begins his first full day of freedom with a morning stroll, a police check-in and a jaunt to the shops.

title.children: Crime figure Tony Mokbel marks first day of freedom with morning walk

image.altText: A model wearing an I love Ozempic shirt

props.synopsis: Less than 1 per cent of models during recent runway shows were plus-sized. Some fear it shows fashion is on a worrying trajectory away from inclusivity.

title.children: 'Smaller is better': Why fashion has turned its back on inclusivity

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: Andrew Liveris says an affordable ticket would be between $30 and $50 — or "something like that".

title.children: Olympics boss promises affordable tickets for Brisbane 2032

image.altText: Drag queens inside a hotel

props.synopsis: Landmark inner-west Sydney pub, The Imperial, has been recognised not just because of "the building but what happened inside".

title.children: Priscilla pub and 'safe space' for gay community heritage listed

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: So, you think you're good at quizzes but don't have the guts to front up to my actual TV show? Well, try this then.

title.children: Ready to flex your trivia muscle? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A close up of Opposition Leader Peter Dutton touching his glasses.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has partially walked back his party's plan to force federal public servants back into the office full time, now saying the edict will only apply to Canberra-based workers.

title.children: Coalition partially walks back public service work-from-home vow

image.altText: A map showing an earthquake epicentre and concentric circles off the coast of Papua New Guinea.

props.synopsis: A magnitude-6.9 earthquake has struck off Papua New Guinea's coast on Saturday morning.

title.children: Magnitude-6.9  quake hits off Papua New Guinea coast

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia wears a backwards cap and white t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A US court orders the Trump administration to bring back a young father who was mistakenly deported to a notorious mega-prison in El Salvador.

title.children: US judge orders return of father deported to mega-prison 'in error'

image.altText: Close up on a bee sitting in a flower on an almond tree

props.synopsis: Some Australian farmers are expecting to reap the benefits of Trump's trade war as international markets look to source products from other regions.

title.children: Fruit, nut growers' profits could bloom as Trump's tariffs anger global markets

image.altText: trump tiktok

props.synopsis: Sources say a deal to spin off the US assets of TikTok has been put on hold, with China indicating it will not approve the deal following US President Donald Trump's tariffs announcement.

title.children: Trump's tariffs put US-China TikTok deal in doubt

image.altText: A woman wearing a green medical shirt named Tamara Hunter.

props.synopsis: Many women who suffer from uterine fibroids are asymptomatic, but others experience intense pelvic pain and heavy periods — and doctors still don't know what causes the condition.

title.children: Anne fell pregnant six times, but never gave birth. Later in life she found out why

image.altText: Three Wedgwood vases

props.synopsis: Wedgwood dinnerware has graced the tables of British nobility and Australian families for generations, and now 170 precious pieces have been painstakingly delivered from the UK to north Queensland for an exclusive exhibition.

title.children: Why a local council paid $330k to secure an exhibition of precious dinnerware
